title: Pause preference not adhered/is unclear
body:
Using `--pause` when starting a daemonized aria2 RPC server seems to not do anything; at least not the way I expect.
When enabled, I expected any download added via the RPC interface to start off in a paused state. However no matter what I try the downloads always immediately start. Am I missing something?

title: Don't send Accept Metalink header if Metalink is disabled
body: Fixes #1298

title: [1.34.0] mirrorbrain detects and rejects downloads through aria2, despite disguise as wget
body:
Hi!

I'm using aria2 to download source tarballs (of [GNOME Meld](https://meldmerge.org/)) with [fetchcommandwrapper](https://github.com/gentoo/fetchcommandwrapper). The precise call to aria2 is this:
```
/usr/bin/aria2c -d /usr/portage/distfiles -o meld-3.18.3.tar.xz --allow-overwrite=true --max-tries=5 --max-file-not-found=2 --user-agent=Wget/1.19.1 --split=1 --max-connection-per-server=1 --uri-selector=inorder https://download.gnome.org/sources/meld/3.18/meld-3.18.3.tar.xz
```
Interestingly, the GNOME server runs [mirrorbrain](http://www.mirrorbrain.org/), detects aria2c somehow (despite the cheap disguise as wget) and returns metalink XML rather than the [`.xz` file I requested](https://github.com/aria2/aria2/files/2591906/meld-3.18.3.tar.xz.xml.txt). Does not happen with actual wget 1.19.5. Bumping the disguise user agent version to 1.19.5 does not help or change anything I would notice.

Because I'm only using a single connection and a single split, that use of aria2 seems perfectly ethical to me and don't really appreciate being blocked for something ethical. I wonder if you know about this behaviour and what you think about it.

Attachments:
* [meld-3.18.3.tar.xz.xml.txt](https://github.com/aria2/aria2/files/2591906/meld-3.18.3.tar.xz.xml.txt) — Metalink XML returned by GNOME's mirrorbrain

title: Seems like the documentation regarding GID is wrong?
body:
Hi:
The documentation regarding GID says

> Set GID manually. aria2 identifies each download by the ID called GID. The GID must be hex string of 16 characters, thus  [0-9a-zA-Z] are allowed and leading zeros must not be stripped. The GID all 0 is reserved and must not be used. The GID must be unique, otherwise error is reported and the download is not added. This option is useful when restoring the sessions saved using --save-session option. If this option is not used, new GID is generated by aria2.

In my test cases I got some error logged by aria2:
```
10/13 08:38:58 [ERROR] Exception caught
Exception: [download_helper.cc:114] errorCode=1 eu5d4zsec34sockw is invalid for GID.

10/13 08:38:58 [ERROR] Exception caught
Exception: [download_helper.cc:114] errorCode=1 fm1alm2cvnbnr178 is invalid for GID.

10/13 08:38:58 [ERROR] Exception caught
Exception: [download_helper.cc:114] errorCode=1 nryb7uwlh9p4tyxy is invalid for GID.

10/13 08:38:58 [ERROR] Exception caught
Exception: [download_helper.cc:114] errorCode=1 kibqkojtvdtsx3q3 is invalid for GID.
[DL:12KiB][#db11c4 2.9MiB/7.7MiB(38%)][#2e68e1 3.1MiB/4.4MiB(72%)]                                                                                                                               
10/13 08:39:08 [ERROR] Exception caught
Exception: [download_helper.cc:114] errorCode=1 eu5d4zsec34sockw is invalid for GID.

10/13 08:39:08 [ERROR] Exception caught
Exception: [download_helper.cc:114] errorCode=1 fm1alm2cvnbnr178 is invalid for GID.

10/13 08:39:08 [ERROR] Exception caught
Exception: [download_helper.cc:114] errorCode=1 nryb7uwlh9p4tyxy is invalid for GID.
```

Seems like these invalid GIDs all contains [g-zG-Z], since the documentation also mentioned that GID needs to be a hex string, I guess that part should be ``thus  [0-9a-fA-F] are allowed`` ?

title: Metalink retry policy
body:
Hey, thanks for an awesome tool!

I have a situation where I am distributing some multi-GB files over an unreliable network and have generated metalinks for them using [metalink.py](https://github.com/j883376/metalink-library/blob/master/metalink.py). The basics of it seem to be working:

```
$ aria2c -V http://vm-mpurvis-xenial-ws/foobar.metalink

09/07 18:16:09 [NOTICE] Downloading 1 item(s)

09/07 18:16:09 [NOTICE] Download complete: /Users/mikepurvis/foobar.metalink

09/07 18:16:09 [ERROR] Checksum error detected. file=/Users/mikepurvis/foobar

09/07 18:16:09 [NOTICE] Allocating disk space. Use --file-allocation=none to disable it. See --file-allocation option in man page for more details.
[#2621e7 2.1GiB/2.2GiB(98%) CN:1 DL:56MiB]                                                                                                                                   
09/07 18:16:56 [NOTICE] Download complete: /Users/mikepurvis/foobar

Download Results:
gid   |stat|avg speed  |path/URI
======+====+===========+=======================================================
b84d0e|OK  |    20MiB/s|/Users/mikepurvis/foobar.metalink
2621e7|OK  |    55MiB/s|/Users/mikepurvis/foobar

Status Legend:
(OK):download completed.
```

However, I've noticed that when the checksum check does fail, it doesn't seem to be able to just redownload the one bad piece— it starts over and redownloads the whole big file from scratch. Is this intended behaviour, or is my metalink file not set up correctly? Here's what it looks like:

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<metalink version="3.0" pubdate="Fri, 07 Sep 2018 22:13:00 GMT" generator="Metalink Library 1.2" xmlns="http://www.metalinker.org/">
  <files>
    <file name="foobar">
      <size>2365399604</size>
      <verification>
        <hash type="ed2k">b5bed018b6dc1403c12de1abf524700a</hash>
        <hash type="md5">205954872137e41d100826be8ab94060</hash>
        <hash type="sha1">89415d398d8c02e16d9de3c45b9c2a20fd978751</hash>
        <hash type="sha256">a47b024a2b86f037fb084eecd795ed542c2f8c834802015c474ce318b0148af2</hash>
        <pieces type="sha1" length="4194304">
          <hash piece="0">fbe11c5643dfe49cdbad56f4521434fadbabb45e</hash>
          <hash piece="1">be9091379e86e401bcab76860f86167879ab2da4</hash>
          <hash piece="2">26a091f83bed724d1644774e73c6a11a0627458a</hash>
          <hash piece="3">db69730d08243a40adac19365dd369191ad337d8</hash>
          <hash piece="4">c24aeafd6b75ff89c9c805a6df75e6ad6a4c399a</hash>
          [ ... ]
        </pieces>
      </verification>
      <resources>
        <url type="http" preference="100">http://vm-mpurvis-xenial-ws/installer/foobar</url>
      </resources>
    </file>
  </files>
</metalink>
```

Any thoughts or guidance is appreciated.

title: JSON-RPC urllib2.HTTPError: HTTP Error 401: Unauthorized
body:
Hi.
I faced with some weird issue.

Here is my test Python script:
```
#!/usr/bin/env python2

import json, urllib2, sys, os
from argparse import ArgumentParser
from collections import defaultdict

jsonreq = json.dumps({'jsonrpc':'2.0', 'id':'qwer', 'method':'aria2.addUri', 'params':
[['https://cs640506.vkuservideo.net/5/u5879182/videos/1f08873a1a.1080.mp4'],
{'max-connection-per-server': 15, 'rpc-user': 'user', 'rpc-passwd': 'password',
'min-split-size': '10M', 'user-agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux; rv:5.0) Gecko/5.0 Firefox/5.0',
'continue': 'true', 'split': 15}]})

print urllib2.urlopen('http://192.168.0.5:6800/jsonrpc/', jsonreq).read()
```

title: Feature Request [Download Link auto-update]
body:
I think it'd be very good if aria2c has a link auto-update feature.

It may work like this, when you run the command you specify the download page and the download link and the download link updater script

for example:

```
aria2c "http://myself.me/downloads/biography.pdf?t=eyheuTahiGUh" --dpage "http://myself.me/downloads/biography.pdf" --update-executable "~/path/to/myself-downloader.py"
```
when the link expires, aria2c will send the dpage to the executable and the executable will print the new download link to stdout

This feature looks great to me

title: Failed to serialize session
body:
I am a big fan of aria2c and I use it via [ocdownloader](https://github.com/DjazzLab/ocdownloader). It's fully working except of the session file that aria2 cannot access for some reason:
`[ERROR] [SaveSessionCommand.cc:86] Failed to serialize session to '/home/user/aria2'`

Aria2 was installed from default ubuntu repos (apt-get install aria2c). I had the same trouble in the past, where I was using aria2 from AUR packages on arch linux. Also I run aria2 with www-data user and granted RW permissions to the file already:
```
ls -la $HOME/aria2
-rw-rw-rw- 1 www-data www-data /home/user/aria2
```
The same thing I did to the log file, also stored in $HOME directive, and it's fully working. However, I am not able to do anything with session file. I tried to play with --deferred-input option, got no changes.

```
/etc/systemd/system/multi-user.target.wants/aria2c.service

[Unit]
Description=Aria2c
After=network.target

[Service]
Type=simple
User=www-data
ExecStart=/usr/bin/aria2c --console-log-level=warn --deferred-input=false --conf-path=/etc/aria2.daemon

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target
```

```
/etc/aria2.daemon

dir=/var/www/downloads
file-allocation=trunc
max-connection-per-server=4
max-concurrent-downloads=2
max-overall-download-limit=0
min-split-size=25M
enable-rpc
rpc-listen-all
check-certificate=false
continue=true
save-session=/home/user/aria2
save-session-interval=1
input-file=/home/user/aria2
force-save=true
log-level=warn
log=/home/user/aria2.log
```
Any suggestions where to dig?

title: fallocate when allocating disk space if the filesystem supports it
body:
Allocating disk space takes some time in aria2. With fallocate(1), I can allocate big files almost instantly:

```sh
$ time fallocate -l 30G big                    
fallocate -l 30G big  0.00s user 0.13s system 86% cpu 0.148 total
```

Could aria2 allocate disk space in this manner instead, if the filesystem supports it? I believe all required documentation is available in fallocate(2).

title: File modified timestamp gets extra hour when original's modified date is in DST range (Windows only?)
body:
When downloading with the timestamp option (`-R, --remote-time true`) the modified date of the downloaded file is exactly *one hour* ahead when the server file has a modified date that's within my tz's DST range.

At least, that's my finding comparing downloading files out- and inside the DST range.
Files outside the DST range seem to get correctly timestamped.

So e.g. a file with a `Last-Modified` datetime of `Mon, 07 Aug 2017 10:23:00 GMT` which Windows displays correctly as 12:23:00 otherwise (tz = GMT+1), becomes 13:23:00 when downloaded with Aria2.

Wget seems to suffer from the same flaw. Curl doesn't.

This is all on Windows (7) btw. Wget on a CentOS VM **doesn't** seem to suffer from this flaw.
Haven't tried to compile Aria2 to test this as well inside the VM.

title: RPC-Server not responding after calling aria2.unpauseAll
body:
Hello !
I'm running aria2c on openWRT using the following command on system startup.

```
aria2c --enable-rpc --rpc-listen-all --allow-overwrite=true --auto-file-renaming=false --continue=true --dir=/mnt/usb/downloads --max-connection-per-server=4 --max-concurrent-downloads=1 --file-allocation=none --piece-length=50M --input-file=/mnt/usb/download_list --pause=true --rpc-secret=Just4Aria2c
```

I have two CRON jobs to start & stop the download progress.

```
00 02 * * * curl http://192.168.1.34:6800/jsonrpc -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "Accept: application/json" --data '{"jsonrpc": "2.0","id":1, "method": "aria2.unpauseAll", "params":["token:Just4Aria2c"]}'

00 06 * * * curl http://192.168.1.34:6800/jsonrpc -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "Accept: application/json" --data '{"jsonrpc": "2.0","id":1, "method": "aria2.pauseAll", "params":["token:Just4Aria2c"]}'
```

The issue is that, after starting download progress using aria2.unpauseAll, you can't send any new command to the rpc server using curl.

Actually, when you type proper curl commands to call aria2c cammands, and then hitting the return key, you don't get any results, it's just waiting and nothing happens in the console.

Thank you sincerely for your help!

title: Bug: file content error with https
body:
Hi,
First of all, appreciate your great work. Aria2c is a great tool!
I noticed a bug with aria2 for years. When I try to download a large file (>500MB) with https protocol with http authentication, it is very likely (~50% cases) that there would be few bytes wrong in the downloaded file.
For example, I meet this issue again today. I used 64bit version of aria2c in Windows 7 SP1. The common I used is:
aria2c.exe -c -R --max-connection-per-server=5 --file-allocation=none --console-log-level=warn --check-certificate=false --http-user=<XXXX> --http-passwd=<XXXX> https://smpdl.sap-ag.de/~swdc/002007974700001465662017D/70SWPM10SP21_2-20009701.sar
The size of the file is 686,971,484 bytes. The file I got with aria2c is wrong starting from offset 0x26EC3EC8 to 0x26EC3F1C (85 bytes). The correct content should be:
0xF4693BB9539CDFB66AF87F2D4FE4D1B26A1CCDA6DAFD20D270CBDB7F99DD940A8EB0A4BC3AEE5E65FFC706C4754AC373223C008008DE7FAA3FD3FE43FD59C3D646D4C9C9DE49C2D0CEC4E63F8BCF2909FAD2D88228
The incorrect content is:
0x1503030050464BF8FCF81959BA757A26C24D673FD60100C7BD7A1E35DE76E8CCAA08571DB7DEAEEDBF24E2FB142B5C0EC91E50D6BF07D50CADDB0633B9D31A23381BCDFE277AD10D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D
I cannot reproduce this issue when downloading this file for the second time.
Similarly, there are also problems with these files:
---------------------

https://smpdl.sap-ag.de/~swdc/002007974700001466622017D/SWPM10SP21_2-20009701.SAR
filesize: 634,163,019 bytes
incorrect part: 0x24A4FEC8-0x24A4FF1C
incorrect content:
0x15030300501F6058FA231F0EEB05A3B501DD26FC050100AEB82790630DF0D56A2EC4AF5143184C581D4DB8E30136E8AC2D2CE1B9CE7F217031D2E98D96874EDAB97445D5378DB00D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D
---------------------
file:

filesize: 627,413,345 bytes
incorrect part: 0xE47BEC8-0xE47BF1C
incorrect content:
0x1503030050A5BF9613BFCFD82AF480CA5DCC35325B01008CF471ACDC911C0314206568C1F394E7D3235ADAE4009AE42F3BC004677A3C431FF5CFC10C04119B04DDDEAF37E4D1340D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D
---------------------
file:
https://smpdl.sap-ag.de/~swdc/002007974700001466672017D/SWPM10SP21_2-20009707.SAR
filesize: 774,572,460 bytes
incorrect part: 0x26F63EC8-0x26F63F1C
incorrect content:
0x1503030050DC2A5B59691B3531DF13BB5247850EB50100E7F1BF9613A7B1C4C5958119F3353C54ADA32CE8C93D2B677B0F33A9B377F5C37CE6BB14E7F4BBA1F333D8F8C3EBFC8E0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D0D

title: Is there a way to make all threads to download the first blocks first?
body:
I'm trying to use multiple connections to download a video file from a HTTP host, and the file is big(say 1 GB).

IIRC, currently the file will be splited equally, and then each connection starts at each one split. For example, if I use 2 connections to download a 1000MB file, one connection will download from 0B, and the second connection will start from 500MB position.

Is it possible to make all connections to download the first blocks? (using the previous example, both threads download the first 500 MB together, then the last 500 MB).

Also, could you point to the code that is related to this logic? I wanted dig into the code myself but am entirely new to the codebase and don't know where to start.

title: [Docs, libaria2] Fix type of obj pushed into options vector
body:
aria2::KeyVals is a vector of pair of std strings, therefore the type of object being pushed should be std::pair<std::string, std::string>,
however in the docs, the type of the said object is KeyVals.
If one follows the docs, their code will fail to compile.

this feature is turned off.

title: Reuse .torrent file instead of redownloading metadata for magnet URI after restarting aria2c
body:
When a magnet URI is added to aria2 using JSON-RPC started using 
bt-save-metadata=true
rpc-save-upload-metadata=true
and other stuff using a configuration file
the metadata is downloaded and saved as a .torrent file, but after saving session and control files after partially downloading, and restarting without forcing, the torrent file is not used. The metadata file is downloaded again. Imagine this situation for a seeder using aria2 having 1000 torrents has to download metadata for all 1000 torrents again in case of a restart even if he/she has all metadata stored as a .torrent file in the same directory as the control files and the downloaded files are.

This can be accomplished by replacing the magnet uri to be saved into the input file using save-session by the path to the .torrent file.

Used aria2c 1.13.0 on Windows 10.

title: Option to immediately save control file
body:
Aria2 seems to only save a control file on a graceful exit or (by default) every 60 seconds.  There doesn't appear to be a way to force a save, and will always wait at least 60 seconds after starting (or whatever is configured) before it saves the initial file.

It may be ideal, in some situations, if a blank control file could be immediately saved when the download is started.  Ideally, this control file should be written before the file to-be-downloaded is preallocated on disk.

This can be useful in some automation cases, for example, automatically resuming after a crash occurs.  With the current behavior, if a download starts but a crash or unexpected shutdown happens within 60 seconds (i.e. before it can write the control file), attempting to resume downloads will fail as the destination file already exists.  This can be worked around via `--allow-overwrite` but this isn't ideal if you actually want the process to fail if the file originally existed.  If a blank control file exists, aria2 can see that it needs to resume this download (although resume from the beginning) rather than fail due to a file existing.

A possible alternative may be to allow incomplete downloads to be named differently (#284), where, if it encounters such a file, it can be "resumed" (again, from the beginning) if no corresponding control file exists.

Thanks for the awesome tool and hope it makes sense :)  
(and apologies if something already exists to do this that I missed (I'm actually running an older version of aria2, and haven't checked whether the latest version acts differently))

For example, I have two torrent files `1.torrent` and `2.torrent`. `2.torrent` is a multi-file torrent and I'd like to download only the first file from it. However, I'd like to download everything that `1.torrent` can offer. Right now, doing this doesn't work as expected -

title: aria2 v1.31.0

title: Fix assertion failure in SimpleRandomizer::getRandomBytes
body:
errno might not be initialized to 0, and we may get both rv == -1 and
errno != ENOSYS.  This leads to assertion failure.  Since
getrandom_linux always returns -1 on failure, checking errno is
useless in this function.

See https://github.com/aria2/aria2/pull/336#issuecomment-270833415

title: propose: default to UTF-8 instead of ISO-8859-1 in Content-Disposition header
body:
I'm having a issue similar to #425 but a little different, like this:
`Content-Disposition: attachment;filename="中文文件名.rar"`
~~of cause it still violates RFC but~~ seems common in China and Chrome/IE/Edge/curl will handle this, firefox won't.

You said in #425 you're ready to accept a patch so I looked a bit into the code, looks like only a few lines of code needed around [here](https://github.com/aria2/aria2/blob/df19921b833d9a46c68fce1da4e54ec677cfa65d/src/util.cc#L1023), there is already an utf8 test routine there called utf8dfa, but I don't know how to access options yet.

~~I'm proposing changing default encode from ISO-8859-1 to UTF-8 without an option, shouldn't break anything, UTF-8 is designed that way.~~

update: sorry I was thinking about ASCII. and I should change the issue title to "an option to default to UTF-8 instead of ISO-8859-1"

BTW, utf8dfa is actually not used correctly there,
https://github.com/aria2/aria2/blob/df19921b833d9a46c68fce1da4e54ec677cfa65d/src/util.cc#L1115
`if (utf8dfa(&dfa_state, &dfa_code, *p) == UTF8_REJECT) {`
*p is `const char`, it should be explicitly converted to `unsigned const char` before implicitly converting to `uint_32t`, for example -1 will be wrongly converted to `0xffffffff` instead of `0x000000ff`, which will result in a disastrous array index out of bounds in utf8dfa.

but, luckily, look up two lines, the utf8dfa call is enclosed in a `if (inRFC5987AttrChar(*p)) {` check block, so it will never trigger, and also render this check entirely pointless, printable ASCII is automatically UTF-8 proof.

title: User home variable expansion
body:
The environment variables, such as `${HOME}`, are expanded by shell.
This means that those variables used in configuration file are not
expanded.  However, it is useful to `${HOME}` to refer user's home
directory in configuration file to specify file paths.  Therefore,
aria2 expands `${HOME}` found in the following option values to
user's home directory:

 * ca-certificate
* certificate
* dht-file-path
* dht-file-path6
* dir
* input-file
* load-cookies
* log
* metalink-file
* netrc-path
* on-bt-download-complete
* on-download-complete
* on-download-error
* on-download-start
* on-download-stop
* on-download_pause
* out
* private-key
* rpc-certificate
* rpc-private-key
* save-cookies
* save-session
* server-stat-if
* server-stat-of
* torrent-file

Note that this expansion occurs even if the above options are used in
the command-line.  This means that expansion may occur 2 times: first,
shell and then aria2c.

Fxies #780

Here I face the embarrassed situation: the `$HOME` couldn't be used in the aria2's conf file while can be used in the terminal command line argument.
Say, run the command below in the terminal 
```shell
aria2c --conf-path=$HOME/.aria2/aria2-chrome.conf
```
will give me this error:
```shell
Exception caught
Exception: [download_helper.cc:528] errorCode=1 Failed to open the file ${HOME}/.aria2/aria2-chrome.session, cause: No such file

or $HOME will fail either.
```
The thing is the file do exist, if I replace `$HOME` with absolute path in the conf file, all things will be ok.

As you may noticed that `$HOME` under OSX is something like `/Users/username` while under Ubuntu is something like `/home/username`. Surely, I can prepare for two version of conf file for this two OS.

Is there any other elegant solution?

title: configure: Use pkg-config to find libs whenever possible
body:
Use pkg-config to find cppunit, libxml2 and expat. All those libraries
provide pkg-config files, and in all of those cases the pkg-config macro
is superior to the custom macros used currently.

The advantages of pkg-config files include:

- Explicit static linking support via --static. Currently, e.g.
'xml2-config --libs' prints all libraries needed for static linking when
doing dynamic linking unnecessary, resulting in unnecessary direct deps.

- Better cross-build support. You don't have to build the additional
*-config tools for target.

- Better multilib support. Per-ABI pkgconfig directories are commonly
supported while packages usually fail to look for per-CHOST *-config
variants.

- Better override support. The current macros allow little to no
result overrides, the pkg-config macros let you pass FOO_CFLAGS
and FOO_LIBS manually.

- Cleaner version checks. The code used in libxml.m4 is really creepy.

title: WinTLS: Rewrite writeData
body:
We re-wrote WinTLSSession::writeData.  The major points are:

* Buffer is now preallocated once handshake is finished.  Previously,
  they are allocated each time when we send one TLS record.

* Schannel uses header, body and trailer for each secBuffer.  Now we
  send them off at once using WSASend which is windows counterpart of
  sendv.  Previously, we do memmove if some of them are truncated.

* We don't try to send application data in
  WinTLSSession::closeConnection, since semantically we need same
  application data used to create TLS record before.  Using 0 length
  data to finish sending buffered data looks like a hack.

title: Unrequested torrent pieces are downloaded anyway in multi-file WebSeeding

Just to trace with an issue the already applied fix: https://github.com/aria2/aria2/commit/90452ae11b51cb7c7e411a939f81f2d455bac59a

title: Aria2c can't resolve hosts on WSL
body:
background: I'm trying to get apt-fast running under the windows subsystem for linux

I thought this was an issue with c-ares at first, since some other c-ares software does not work properly on WSL, but when compiling c-ares myself, the adig/ahost tools work fine, and aria2 still does not resolve hosts.

I've self-compiled libc-ares2 and libc-ares-dev from the official ubuntu sources on both trusty and xenial with the following commands:

```
apt-get build-dep c-ares aria2
apt-get source c-ares aria2
pushd c-ares*
debuild -r fakeroot --preserve-env
popd
dpkg -i *ares*.deb
pushd aria2*
debuild -r fakeroot --preserve-env
popd
dpkg -i *.deb
```

And this is the results I get:

```
root@Win10-vm-2:/home/Efreak/sources# c-ares-1.10.0/ahost google.com
google.com                              216.58.217.206
root@Win10-vm-2:/home/Efreak/sources# aria2-1.18.1/src/aria2c http://google.com

10/10 18:20:03 [ERROR] CUID#6 - Download aborted. URI=http://google.com
Exception: [AbstractCommand.cc:312] errorCode=19 URI=http://google.com
  -> [AbstractCommand.cc:739] errorCode=19 CUID#6 - Name resolution for google.com failed:No address returned
```

I've tried this in a WSL/trusty (default) environment under WSL, and I've also tried it in a VM that has had WSL updated to Xenial. Both have the same results, though xenial is using an newer version of aria2 (1.19.0)

I'll be checking the latest version of aria2c (1.27.1) shortly, but I don't expect that to change anything.

title: Release aria2 1.27.0 wrong title and missing libssl_compat.h file in src
body:
The title will be 1.27.0 not 1.17.0.

Missing libssl_compat.h file in src with all source pack.

title: feature request: clobber and/or filename when exists
body:
#709 resolves one naming problem for downloaded files, but leaves another: there's no clobber support. Skype, for example, always uses the same download filename (SkypeSetup.msi) so even in 1.26.1 I'll get SkypeSetup.1.msi when I download it using aria2 when a another file exists. I'd like to be able to use the same local filename, overwriting the existing SkypeSetup.msi if the new file has the same name.

Alternatively, it would be great if when running a script that calls aria2, it were possible to know what the downloaded filename is if the file is skipped as current. Again, with Skype, if SkypeSetup.msi already exists and is unchanged from my last run of aria2, it will not be downloaded again. But there are no log indications what the filename is for the file that was skipped, only the URL, which does me no good locally.

title: Downloading stops after first url in list is complete

More info:
aria2c is launched from a shell script using the command:
`nohup aria2c --conf-path="$ARIA_DIR/aria2c.conf" --input-file="$ARIA_DIR/aria2c_url_list.txt" --dir="$ARIA_DIR/downloads" --log="$ARIA_DIR/aria2c.log" &`

The shell script I use to start the download:

```
#!/bin/sh

if [ $(date +%H) -lt 8 ]
then
    ARIA_DIR="/mnt/ntfs-media/downloads/aria2c"

    cd "$ARIA_DIR"

    # Change the default STDOUT and STDERR for the entire script so they
    # are automatically written to the appropriate file.

    # Copy STDOUT file descriptor and close original
    exec 3>&1 1<&-

    # Copy STDERR file descriptor and close original
    exec 4>&2 2<&-

    # Open STDOUT as file in append mode.
    exec 1>> "$ARIA_DIR/stdout.txt"

    # Open STDERR as file in append mode.
    exec 2>> "$ARIA_DIR/stderr.txt"

    echo "" >> "$ARIA_DIR/aria2c.log"
    date +"%F %T" >> "$ARIA_DIR/aria2c.log"

    nohup aria2c --conf-path="$ARIA_DIR/aria2c.conf" --input-file="$ARIA_DIR/aria2c_url_list.txt" --dir="$ARIA_DIR/downloads" --log="$ARIA_DIR/aria2c.log" &

    nohup echo "pkill aria2c &" | at 0800
fi
```

title: aria2 1.27.0
body: The current release date of aria2 1.27.0 is September 15.  The feature/documentation freeze period will start on September 8.

title: Remove custom ftruncate64 for Android
body:
The latest NDK versions support ftruncate64, so building a local copy of ftruncate64 is no longer needed.

Also, the arm and x86 builds of ftruncate64 failed when targetting API level 21 or higher, as they include <linux/err.h> which are not present starting from API level 21.

title: Bugfix: Unauthorized call in aria2mon
body:
Hi,

in commit a9fe783484e9196d05b9ea99f441f129365c7034, you already introduced the "secret" parameter to aria2mon. However, in the following call to `aria2.getFiles`, you do not use it, which causes a "Unauthorized (XMLRPC::FaultException)".

Therefore, I replaced the "direct" `client.call` with the local method `client_call` and put the (potential empty) secret as second parameter, so that `clent_call` can either ignore or use it.

title: High Speed Performance Problems
body:
Hi
I have 1Gbps home connection, usually when I use IDM or FDM to grab a single file from my server, set the connection number to 8, I got 30M/s average download speed,but when I use aria2 (Version: windows10 1.25.0) to download,setting the split number from 6-16,the download speed just stuck in 16M/s,no mater what value I change in split number.
I have also checked my disk and memory usage,both are just around 50% when I was using aria2 to download,so I guess it's not my computer performance that limit the download speed.

I don't know whether there is an internal speed limit or bug in aria2,but I just have tried IDM,FDM,EagleGet,OrbitDownloader,all of them can get a download speed around 30M/s,so it seems that aria2 really meet some problems compared to other download softwares
Hope you can help me fix the problem.
Thanks

My aria2 run.vbs are just like below:
`Option Explicit
Dim WMIService, Process, Processes, Flag, WS
Set WMIService = GetObject("winmgmts:{impersonationlevel=impersonate}!\\.\root\cimv2")
Set Processes = WMIService.ExecQuery("select * from win32_process")
Flag = true
for each Process in Processes
    if strcomp(Process.name, "aria2c.exe") = 0 then
        Flag = false
        exit for
    end if
next
Set WMIService = nothing
if Flag then
    Set WS = Wscript.CreateObject("Wscript.Shell")
    WS.Run "aria2c --conf-path=aria2.conf -D", 0
end if`

My aria2 configuration are just like below:

> dir=J:\

disk-cache=512M
# 文件预分配方式, 能有效降低磁盘碎片, 默认:prealloc
# 预分配所需时间: none < falloc ? trunc < prealloc
# falloc和trunc则需要文件系统和内核支持, NTFS建议使用falloc, EXT3/4建议trunc

file-allocation=falloc
# 断点续传

continue=true
check-certificate=false
log=D:\aria2-1.20.0-win-64bit-build1\log.txt

http-auth-challenge=true
http-user=****
http-passwd=*******
## 下载连接相关
# 最大同时下载任务数, 运行时可修改, 默认:5

max-concurrent-downloads=2
# 同一服务器连接数, 添加时可指定, 默认:1

max-connection-per-server=10
# 最小文件分片大小, 添加时可指定, 取值范围1M -1024M, 默认:20M
# 假定size=10M, 文件为20MiB 则使用两个来源下载; 文件为15MiB 则使用一个来源下载

min-split-size=50M
# peice选择，inorder,random,geom
# stream-piece-selector=inorder
# 单个任务最大线程数, 添加时可指定, 默认:5

split=8
# 整体下载速度限制, 运行时可修改, 默认:0
# max-overall-download-limit=0
# 单个任务下载速度限制, 默认:0
# max-download-limit=0
# 整体上传速度限制, 运行时可修改, 默认:0
# max-overall-upload-limit=0
# 单个任务上传速度限制, 默认:0
# max-upload-limit=0
# 禁用IPv6, 默认:false

disable-ipv6=false
## 进度保存相关
# 从会话文件中读取下载任务

input-file=aria2.session
# 在Aria2退出时保存`错误/未完成`的下载任务到会话文件

save-session=aria2.session
# 定时保存会话, 0为退出时才保存, 需1.16.1以上版本, 默认:0

save-session-interval=60
## RPC相关设置
# 启用RPC, 默认:false

enable-rpc=true
# 允许所有来源, 默认:false

rpc-allow-origin-all=true
# 允许非外部访问, 默认:false

rpc-listen-all=true
# 事件轮询方式, 取值:[epoll, kqueue, port, poll, select], 不同系统默认值不同
# event-poll=select
# RPC监听端口, 端口被占用时可以修改, 默认:6800
# rpc-listen-port=6800
## BT/PT下载相关
# 当下载的是一个种子(以.torrent结尾)时, 自动开始BT任务, 默认:true
# follow-torrent=true
# BT监听端口, 当端口被屏蔽时使用, 默认:6881-6999

listen-port=51413
# 单个种子最大连接数, 默认:55
# bt-max-peers=55
# 打开DHT功能, PT需要禁用, 默认:true

enable-dht=false
# 打开IPv6 DHT功能, PT需要禁用
# enable-dht6=false
# DHT网络监听端口, 默认:6881-6999
# dht-listen-port=6881-6999
# 本地节点查找, PT需要禁用, 默认:false
# bt-enable-lpd=false
# 种子交换, PT需要禁用, 默认:true

enable-peer-exchange=false
# 每个种子限速, 对少种的PT很有用, 默认:50K
# bt-request-peer-speed-limit=50K
# 客户端伪装, PT需要

peer-id-prefix=-TR2770-
user-agent=Transmission/2.77
# 当种子的分享率达到这个数时, 自动停止做种, 0为一直做种, 默认:1.0

seed-ratio=0
# 强制保存会话, 话即使任务已经完成, 默认:false
# 较新的版本开启后会在任务完成后依然保留.aria2文件

force-save=false

title: Link failure with ld.gold, -Wl,--as-needed and --enable-libaria2
body:
When aria2 is built with `--enable-libaria2` most of the relevant code is built into the shared library. However, `src/Makefile.am` puts almost all linked dependency libraries into `LDADD` which applies to executables only. Therefore, most of the NEEDED entries land in the executable rather than the library.

This has two consequences:
1. The library lacks proper dependencies and therefore can't be used by a program unless it links to all its dependency libraries directly.
2. If aria2c is linked using ld.gold (the new binutils linker) with `-Wl,--as-needed`, the linker detects that aria2c executable does not use most of the passed `-l` libraries and removes them. As a result, aria2c is broken since neither the program nor the library links to necessary dependency libraries.

I think the correct solution here is to move all the dependency libraries from `LDADD` to `libaria2_la_LIBADD`.

title: allow seconds for seed-time (fractional minutes)
body: This allows aria2 to stay up for seeding during seconds and not only full minutes. This is interesting on high speed networks with large number of clients who actually need the file quickly but still want to participate in case all servers need the same file at almost the same time.

title: aria2 http/ftp download stuck at 0KB/s even with lowest-speed-limit set
body:
I use aria2 to download multiple files using ftp or http. This bug has appeared after version **1.15**. I tested this issue with version **1.18**, **1.23** and **1.24** . A while after starting aria2, it decides to stop downloading and gets stuck at 0 KB/s although i have set **lowest-speed-limit=1K**. Sometimes this issue happens within minutes of starting the download and sometimes it takes hours for it to happen. But when i set it to download files at night, every morning i find it stuck at 0 KB/s. This issue happens with and without setting **max-overall-download-limit** parameter.

Here are some more info that might help:
- parameters i use: **-j2 -x8 -s4 -c -m0 --retry-wait=600 -i ~/shared/urls.txt -d ~/mb1/downloads/ --deferred-input=true --download-result=full --lowest-speed-limit=1K --log-level=error -laria.log**
- urls.txt contains urls for multiple files to be downloaded.
- The computer executing aria2 has one IPv4 address and is behind NAT.
- I haven't tested this with torrents
- When connection speed drops below the value set for **lowest-speed-limit**, aria2 correctly stops downloading and continues with the next file but sometimes it doesn't happen and it gets stuck.
- Running aria2 with or without sudo permissions doesn't change the issue
- This happens both on **Ubuntu Server 14.04 x64** and **Raspbian Jessie** (haven't tested another OS)

title: Aria2c treats absolute paths as if they were relative
body:
When downloading an URL using the `-o` option referring to an absolute path, aria2c always assumes that the path provided is a relative path, and merges it with the current working directory.

Thus, if I tell it `aria2c -o /index.html http://example.com/index.html`, it will save it to `$PWD//index.html` and not to `/index.html` which was what I expected.

In the man page I found no indication that this may be intended behaviour.

Here is some information that may be relevant, from `aria2c --version`:

```
aria2 version 1.24.0
(...)
** Configuration **
Enabled Features: Async DNS, BitTorrent, Firefox3 Cookie, GZip, HTTPS, Message Digest, Metalink, XML-RPC, SFTP
Hash Algorithms: sha-1, sha-224, sha-256, sha-384, sha-512, md5, adler32

title: Sparse corrupted files
body:
I proceeded massive downloads (70,731 gzipped files - 819GB in total) from a private FTP server with the following command:
    aria2c -i reporfiles.all -c -j25 -x5 -s5 -k64M --save-session=reportfiles.all

reportfiles.all file contains the path to the files. Eg:
    ftp://XXXXXXX:XXXXXXX@private-ftpserver.com/dir1/dir2/dir3/dir4/file987.gz

aria2 (version 1.13.0) downloaded all the files without throwing a single error and reportfiles.all ended up empty, however, I got 69 corrupted gzipped file ('unexpected end of file') and also noticed that the temporary aria2-suffixed file are not deleted. I believe that the download of these files is complete but not 'finalized'.
At this point I can't figure the reason of this 0.1% failure: The private FTP server (flacky network?) or my settings (it works fine for 99% of the downloads though?).

title: torrent metadata not transferring
body:
If I generate a smaller torrent (using py3createtorrent), I'm able to distribute metadata and download the file, but when I create a much larger one, metadata won't transfer.

seeding/downloading notepad++ like so, I can download it, very small download. Here are the commands I'm using. It downloads the metadata and saves a .torrent file.

seed: aria2c NotepadPlusPlus#6.9.2.torrent --file-allocation=none --seed-ratio=0 --bt-enable-lpd=true --bt-seed-unverified=true --bt-exclude-tracker=\* --bt-tracker=[redact]/announce --log-level=notice

peer: aria2c "magnet:?xt=urn:btih:3404428114D15A2F8F539302961B86831D2B1FD4&dn" -V --bt-save-metadata=true --bt-stop-timeout=60 --bt-enable-lpd=true --allow-overwrite=true --seed-time=0 --file-allocation=none --bt-tracker=[redact]/announce

However, if I do a much larger software package, 7 gigabytes and 14,000 files about, using the same syntax, it will not download the metadata for the torrent. It shows eg, CN:1 and SD:1 on console, so I'm quite sure I've got the hash correct for the magnet link. 

If instead of using a magnet link, I copy the torrent file to the peer and call aria2c substituting that in for the magnet link, it's able to download.

I don't think I'm doing anything wrong. Could this be an aria2c bug?

body:
I am running a minimal image of pi.

H/W Details-
RASPBERRY PI MODEL B 756-8308 Raspberry Pi B
TP-LINK TL-WN725N Wireless N Nano USB Adapter
Uname -a output --> Linux pi 3.12.25+ #700 PREEMPT Thu Jul 24 17:51:46 BST 2014 armv6l GNU/Linux

I was using pi as a headless download server using aria2 (aria2 version 1.15.1).
pi was connected to internet via Wifi with my ISP provided wifi router. LAN port of PI was not used at all.
All was working great up until 2 days back.

2 Days ago, i switched to a different ISP with a better deal. To save money, I declined to buy their wifi router.
They installed a CAT5 cable and gave a static IP. I tested it with my laptop, all worked well.

After 2 days of googling, I managed to configure Wifi Access point on my pi.
Now my external IP is configured on pi Ethernet card. And wifi card provided access point to my devices.
I am using hostapd and udhcpd.

Today I noticed that aria2 running on my pi (I access it via webgui) is not downloading any torrents or magnet link.

title: (Compatibility) chocolatey package
body:
Just a request not to change your method for constructing filenames for Windows when issuing builds, or if you do, I would appreciate a shoutout.

Details: I maintain a chocolatey package for aria2 at https://chocolatey.org/packages/aria2/ If you are not familiar, chocolatey is a fork of nuget for installed programs, with improvements to be a package manager like `apt-get`.

It does this by installing from a defined URL within the pkg, which is immutable. So if the URL changes, the pkg no longer works. (see https://chocolatey.org/packages/aria2/#files and click "show" to see script used)

I automatically build the packages by scraping https://github.com/aria2/aria2/releases and getting the version from the filename of the zip, e.g. `/aria2-1.23.0-win-64bit-build1.zip`

I previously was only using "aria2-**1.23.0**-win-64bit-build1.zip" since it appeared buildX was consistently `build1` ... however you replaced it with build2 which broke the pkg since build1 was no longer present. I understand why you want to just update the single file than issue a new version release and I resolved that by now including the build number in my version so `1.23.0.2`

So if the filename changes from that format, it may break my regex to obtain the proper version and install URL.

ref: https://github.com/dtgm/chocolatey-packages/issues/215

title: Post hook script and socks5 proxy
body:
Is there a way to support argument like `--after-script="/home/usr/upload.sh"` which will execute `/home/usr/upload.sh` when download is complete?   Maybe `int system( const char *command )` in `<stdlib.h>` is a simple choice.  Maybe we need `--enable-after-script=false` for default.

[Shadowsocks](https://github.com/shadowsocks/shadowsocks) which uses socks5 is widely used in China except for VPN. It runs on almost all kind of devices.  A great deal of programming sites are blocked in China by GFW. Such as golang.org chromium.org android.com. I know that we can convert socks5 to http proxy, but we need different software on different platform. How about supporting socks5 in aria2?

title: Stop using paths.d for MacOS X build
body:
I found #159 where the decision to use /etc/paths.d/aria2c was mentioned.

I'd prefer to avoid this since aria2c is only a single binary, where things like git have many. I don't need yet another addition to my $PATH when a symbolic link will do just as well.

For now, I've done this manually on my system.

$ sudo rm /etc/paths.d/arai2c
$ sudo ln -vs ../aria2/bin/aria2c /usr/local/bin

$ ls -l /usr/local/bin/aria2c
lrwxr-xr-x  1 root  wheel  19 Jun  5 16:23 /usr/local/bin/aria2c -> ../aria2/bin/aria2c

title: added filesize overflow check for mmap on 32bit os
body:
This has been causing problems with my 32-bit ARMv7L machine. 

It seems like aria2 is compiled with 64-bit offset support so the `filesize` (`st_size` of [`stat`](http://linux.die.net/man/2/stat)) would be a 64-bit `off_t`, even in a 32-bit O/S. 

The problem is, `length` arg in [`mmap`](http://linux.die.net/man/2/mmap) is a 32-bit `size_t` in 32-bit O/S, so the input, `filesize`, would be truncated and the mmap would not be mapping into a correct size of address space.

This will cause `SIGSEGV` in later `memcpy` operations.

title: Incorrect handling of peer-id-prefix option
body:
If I launch aria2 with --peer-id-prefix="-BC0140-", it urlencodes this value and uses such request to the tracker:

GET /announce.php?passkey=.../&info_hash=...&peer_id=%2DBC0140%2D%3E%B7b%E4h%B....

But original client doesn't urlencode "-" symbol:

GET /announce.php?passkey=.../&info_hash=...&peer_id=-BC0140-K%D9%1EpK%BA%1B%DC....

Would it be possible to avoid urlencoding of "-" symbol because it doesn't have a reserved purpose and can be passed without encoding?

title: aria2 torrent individual file download
body:
Hi,

I am using Aria2 Version 1.15.1  on my raspberry pi (3.12.25+ #700 PREEMPT).
I have 3 questions about downloading torrents via aria2
1.  If a torrent has multiple files, can I prioritize their download. Let's say a torrent has 24 files - file1.pdf,file2,pdf...file 24.pdf. Can I mark them sequentially so file 1 is downloaded first, then 2 etc. I googled it and it looks like its not possible
2. If question 1 is not possible. Is there a way to check the download status of individual files with in a torrent ? Aria2 doesn't marks incomplete files as .part or something, so it becomes tricky to identify which file has downloaded and which are still going on.
3. If question 1 and 2 are not possible. Can aria2 email once an individual file download finishes ?
   Right now it emails me when the whole torrent is finished (all 24 files). 

Thanks in Advance.
Great software
Jab.

title: SetFileValidData (falloc in Windows) seems to fail in 1.23.0 build 1
body:
Hi, I'm using --file-allocation=falloc with the current build of 1.23.0 for Windows (the 64-bit one) and aside from the usual warning about that file allocation method under Windows there's one that didn't appear before:

File allocation (SetFileValidData) failed (cause: A required privilege is not held by the client.).

Resulting in aria2 allocating space by filling with zeroes. I tried with different downloads both torrent and http based ones at least lead to this even though I launched aria2 from an administrative prompt.

Such warning didn't appear in the previous build (1.22.0 build 1, 64-bit), and doesn't appear now either if the download is small: a 2.3MB file doesn't trigger it for example, a 300MB one does.

title: Add $HOME/.config/aria2/aria2.conf to config path
body: Most modern Linux utils try to save their config files in `$HOME/.config/<toolname>` instead of `$HOME/.<toolname>`. Aria2 should follow suit and also look for a file there.

I have a question.I download a lot torrents simultaneously. 100-200. 
Some torrents are downloaded very slowly. It indicates that there is no connections. 
Although I do know that at about 1000 torrent seeders.
In the logs I see these records.
2016-05-13 10:49:04.827940 [DEBUG] [DHTTaskQueueImpl.cc:57] Updating periodicTaskQueue1
2016-05-13 10:49:04.827945 [DEBUG] [DHTTaskExecutor.cc:77] Executing 5 Task(s). Queue has 13 task(s).

title: Allow --max-connection-per-server to go up to 128.
body:
Some ISPs seem to limit the maximum bitrate per TCP session through some
routes. Greatly increasing the number of connections to a remote server
allows user to bypass these artificial limitations.

title: import-po: iterate on glob, not ls output
Restart active download to apply previously not applicable options
body:
Previously, we categorized options that can be used in
aria2.changeOption RPC method into 2 categories.  The options in one
category can be applied on the fly, meaning that download continues to
be active while applying options.  Another category includes options
which are only applicable when downloads are waiting or paused.

In this change, when active download is ordered to change options
which only applicable in waiting or paused state, it is now paused,
and then automatically restarted.  Although we have limited number of
download concurrency, the pause and restart is done atomically, and
the download is inserted at the front of the queue, it is picked up
immediately if the concurrency regulation allows.

title: Change selection of files inside a torrent on the fly
body:
Currently the torrent download needs to be stopped, then the selection made and then download to be restarted if you want to select a subset of files in the torrent download.

This is contradictory to other solutions (_cough_ transmission-daemon _cough_) and is really inconvenient, it cannot even be properly automated by a front end.

Please implement selecting/changing the subset of files to be downloaded within a torrent download "on the fly", without the need to stop it.

title: No ability to disable download results
body:
```
aria2c --console-log-level=error https://aur.archlinux.org
[#18fe58 0B/0B CN:1 DL:0B]                                                                                                                                    
Download Results:
gid   |stat|avg speed  |path/URI
======+====+===========+=======================================================
18fe58|OK  |    10KiB/s|/home/archie/index.html

Status Legend:
(OK):download completed.
```

On error:

```
$ aria2c --console-log-level=error https://aur.archlinux.ofewewfrg

04/26 13:01:27 [ERROR] CUID#7 - Download aborted. URI=https://aur.archlinux.ofewewfrg
Exception: [AbstractCommand.cc:345] errorCode=19 URI=https://aur.archlinux.ofewewfrg
  -> [AbstractCommand.cc:783] errorCode=19 CUID#7 - Name resolution for aur.archlinux.ofewewfrg failed:Domain name not found

Download Results:
gid   |stat|avg speed  |path/URI
======+====+===========+=======================================================
874257|ERR |       0B/s|https://aur.archlinux.ofewewfrg

Status Legend:
(ERR):error occurred.

aria2 will resume download if the transfer is restarted.
```

Both download results and errors are printed on stdout (#638), so `aria2c >/dev/null` wouldn't have the desired result. A workaround in scripts/pipes is to save the log to a file, and mention the user to read it. Having the error printed directly, preferably to stderr, would be more effective.

title: place errors on stderr, instead of stdout
body: Right now, aria2c prints diagnostics on stdout, which makes it more difficult to use in scripts (in particular, shell pipes). curl and wget print to stderr instead.

title: returns 0 when file/stdin is empty with -i
body:
```
% touch foo
% aria2c -i foo
No files to download.
% echo $?
0
```

Compare to:

```
aria2 
zsh: correct 'aria2' to 'aria2c' [nyae]? y
Specify at least one URL.
Usage: aria2c [OPTIONS] [URI | MAGNET | TORRENT_FILE | METALINK_FILE]...
See 'aria2c -h'.
% echo $?
1
```

According to `EXIT STATUS` in `aria2c(1)`, **0** means `If all downloads were successful.` You could argue that if there are no downloads to succeed, that then downloads are in fact successful; however this is a roundabout. I would suggest e.g. **3**, `If a resource was not found.`

See also this discussion for wget (which unfortunately decided against a non-zero exit code):

http://www.mail-archive.com/wget@sunsite.dk/msg10655.html

title: Download Complete NOTICE doesn't report correct saved file path
body:
here is a sample metalink4 file,

```
<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<metalink xmlns="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:metalink">
    <file name="dir/becreated/file.saved">
        <url>http://localhost/place/to/download/file</url>
    </file>
</metalink>
```

as you can see the file name imply file will be saved into certain directory structure,
and it do saved to that path relatively,

> D:\test\dir\becreated\file.saved

but the download complete notice tells another story,
which is kind of confuse.

> 04/21 19:44:47 [NOTICE] Download complete: D:/test/file.saved

related part

> RequestGroup::reportDownloadFinished
> https://github.com/aria2/aria2/blob/c9e2223741f9627f27b3d2befef48acdd79d504d/src/RequestGroup.cc#L1150

title: about --max-mmap-limit=<SIZE>
body:
> --max-mmap-limit=<SIZE>
> Set the maximum file size to enable mmap (see --enable-mmap option). The file size is determined by the sum of all files contained in one download. For example, if a download contains 5 files, then file size is the total size of those files. If file size is strictly greater than the size specified in this option, mmap will be disabled. Default: 9223372036854775807

Can i use  `max-mmap-limit=2048M` ?

title: I compile aria2 android version, there is no error, but get aria2c too large，size > 60M
body:
I download the compiled version of the android is 3 m, but my own compilation with 60 m.
It can work on android, but I don't understand why his compilation of so big

title: JSON-RPC batch and system.multicall
body:
I want to add a batch/multicall helper to aria2.js https://github.com/sonnyp/aria2.js/issues/10 and I have a few questions

1) By reading aria2 code/documentation it's unclear to me if there are conceptual/functional differences between the two or if system.multicall is simply batch for XML-RPC.

2) In the case there is no differences, should I prefer JSON-RPC batch over multicall?

> The secret token validation in aria2 is designed to take at least a certain amount of time to mitigate brute-force/dictionary attacks against the RPC interface. Therefore it is recommended to prefer Batch or system.multicall requests when appropriate. 

3) I don't follow the conclusion of the first sentence? Does it mean using batch/multicall is a way to reduce 'flooding' so that the brute-force/dictionary attack protection doesn't kick off for a large number of requests? What is the rate limit?

4) Does it mean batch/multicall should always be preferred over multiple requests? Even for WebSocket transport?

I'll be happy to send a documentation PR and see if I can clarify those points with your help.

title: Completion of error handling
body:
Would you like to add more error handling for return values from functions like the following?
- [sigaction](http://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/functions/realloc.html) ⇒ [setGlobalSignalHandler](https://github.com/tatsuhiro-t/aria2/blob/f0f1b8ef47c391550ff99982f1cad3dd4e1d410d/src/util.cc#L1309)
- [strdup](http://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/functions/strdup.html) ⇒ [putOptions](https://github.com/tatsuhiro-t/aria2/blob/f0f1b8ef47c391550ff99982f1cad3dd4e1d410d/src/OptionParser.cc#L85)

title: How can i get the file list of BTtorrent by json-rpc
body:
#### i tried

`{"jsonrpc": "2.0", "id": "aria2addTorrent", "method":"aria2.addTorrent","params":["base64 of .torrent file", [], {"show-files":"true"}]}`
#### nothing returned
#### but

`aria2c ./xxxxxx.torrent -S`
#### works well

body:

Regards

enable-dht=false

summary-interval=0

I am using webui-aria2 @ziahamza
But I tried downloading files of 1 to 2 MBs. It works fine.
But when I tried to download a larger file it failed.
Here is the link of the file http://get.videolan.org/vlc/2.2.2/win64/vlc-2.2.2-win64.exe

title: aria2 1.22.0
body: The next release, v1.22.0, will be released on April, 15.  The documentation/feature freeze has begun on April, 5.

title: No file saved after downloading using release version
body: This is Windows 7 SP1 64bit and using release-1.21.0. Both 32bit and 64bit built version cannot save file after downloading, even cannot save the session file.

title: aria2c does not run under torify
body:
Originally mentioned in #153, and while related to it, it really deserves its own bug report.

austin@debian-laptop:~$ torify aria2c http://example.com

04/01 19:31:38 [ERROR] CUID#7 - Download aborted. URI=http://example.com
Exception: [AbstractCommand.cc:345] errorCode=19 URI=http://example.com
  -> [AbstractCommand.cc:783] errorCode=19 CUID#7 - Name resolution for example.com failed:Could not contact DNS servers

04/01 19:31:38 [NOTICE] Download GID#566f2863738d29ad not complete: 

Download Results:
gid   |stat|avg speed  |path/URI
======+====+===========+=======================================================
566f28|ERR |        n/a|http://example.com

Status Legend:
(ERR):error occurred.

aria2 will resume download if the transfer is restarted.
If there are any errors, then see the log file. See '-l' option in help/man page for details.

Note that wget works:
austin@debian-laptop:~$ torify wget http://example.com
--2016-04-01 19:31:41--  http://example.com/
Resolving example.com (example.com)... 93.184.216.34
Connecting to example.com (example.com)|93.184.216.34|:80... connected.
HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 200 OK
Length: 1270 (1.2K) [text/html]
Saving to: ‘index.html'

index.html                                    100%[=====================================================================================================>]   1.24K  7.89KB/s    in 0.2s    

2016-04-01 19:31:42 (7.89 KB/s) - ‘index.html’ saved [1270/1270]

and if torify is disabled, it works:
austin@debian-laptop:~$ aria2c http://example.com

04/01 19:33:03 [NOTICE] Download complete: /home/austin/index.html

Download Results:
gid   |stat|avg speed  |path/URI
======+====+===========+=======================================================
52a9d4|OK  |        n/a|/home/austin/index.html

Status Legend:
(OK):download completed.

title: aria2.tellStatus removes bittorrent key in JSONRPC when status = complete
body:
Hi. Using 1.21.0. Don't know if it's a bug or expected behaviour:
bittorrent struct reported by aria2.tellStatus dissapears once the torrent is completed and stopped. That makes impossible to get some useful info with Event Hook on-download-stop script like the name and mode.

Could you keep this info available?

Thank you.

Platform: Windows 10 x64
Command: `aria2c --file-allocation=none "https://webtorrent.io/torrents/sintel.torrent"`

title: Issue with metalink + multi-file torrent
body:
Hi. Thanks for the great work on aria2 and metalink.

I am trying to create a metalink file to download the Fedora 23 server DVD iso. I want to include the torrent information in this metalink. The [torrent file](https://torrent.fedoraproject.org/torrents/Fedora-Server-DVD-x86_64-23.torrent) provided by fedora has two files in it:

```
[root@f23vanilla bin]# aria2c -S Fedora-Server-DVD-x86_64-23.torrent 
>>> Printing the contents of file 'Fedora-Server-DVD-x86_64-23.torrent'...
*** BitTorrent File Information ***
Creation Date: Tue, 03 Nov 2015 01:40:50 GMT
Mode: multi
Announce:
 http://torrent.fedoraproject.org:6969/announce
Info Hash: 54a2ba1c02a2f07a8f4d48754c52088dc4ed7b58
Piece Length: 256KiB
The Number of Pieces: 8201
Total Length: 2.0GiB (2,149,581,942)
Name: Fedora-Server-DVD-x86_64-23
Magnet URI: magnet:?xt=urn:btih:54A2BA1C02A2F07A8F4D48754C52088DC4ED7B58&dn=Fedora-Server-DVD-x86_64-23&tr=http%3A%2F%2Ftorrent.fedoraproject.org%3A6969%2Fannounce

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>

</metalink>
```

But when I try to download with `aria2c` (from aria2-1.19.3-1.fc23.x86_64 on fedora) I get the following:

```
[root@f23vanilla bin]# aria2c fedora.meta4 

03/26 17:05:24 [NOTICE] Download complete: /root/rpmbuild/BUILDROOT/wget-1.17.1-1.fc23.x86_64/usr/bin/Fedora-Server-DVD-x86_64-23.torrent

Dusty

title: torrent can't be downloaded due to gzip content-encoding
body:
Hi Tatsuhiro-t

Here I am again, continuing from my last post on failing to download some torrents due to re-directed download link.

I had no idea on what's going on, but one of my friends identified that the problem may be caused by aria2 failed to recognise `content-encoding: gzip` (Aria2 can recognise `Content-Encoding: gzip`, but not `content-encoding: gzip`). This bug keeps aria2 downloading gzip file instead of a genuine torrent which break follow-torrent function.

Could you please look into it and fix it? Thanks.

title: BT Torrent downloaded can't be open
body:
Hi Tatsuhiro-t

Something is not right with the torrent downloaded by Aria2.

First, I found that the BT task won't start automatically after downloading torrent even though I've already enabled the follow-torrent=true in the configuration. I thought it must be some setting issue.

However, when I try to manually load the torrent downloaded, it gives "Bencode decoding failed" error (I'm using an Aria2UI). Weirdly, when I download the same torrent using chrome, the same torrent can then be loaded in Aria2. That's how I draw the conclusion. I've tested on a few different sites, and it gave me the same result. Could you please fix this issue as well as the "follow-torrent" function? Thanks.

title: Does Aria2 support ed2k download links?
body:
Hi Tatsuhiro-t

First please let me thank you for the amazing work you've done so far. Aria2 is definitely one of the amazing things that comes to my life, and it's now an essential part of my browsing experience.

Since I'm still quite new to the utility, just wonder if Aria2 supports ed2k download links (i.e. eDonkey Network)?

If the answer is positive, could you please give me some guidance on how to set things up as it's now the only thing that's not working at the moment.

If the answer is negative, it would be nice to know if this function will be supported in the soon future. Thanks.

title: Move to aria2 github organization
body:
As discussed in https://github.com/tatsuhiro-t/aria2/issues/407, we are considering to move this repository to [aria2 github organization](https://github.com/aria2).  The aria2 web site is already served from the repository under that organization.

The move should be very easy since github has a good job to redirect all the stuff to the new location.  We can retroactively fix the links in the documents.

We plan the relocation on March 26, if there is no objection.

title: Report verifiedLength in tellStatus
body:
Allows RPC clients to view progress of the check integrity step.

I didn't notice any tests for TellStatus so I havn't tried to make any for this branch. One other modification I would like to make but wasn't sure how to implement would be reporting if a particular download was in the queue to have its integrity checked (in the CheckIntegrityMan deque). If you had any thoughts on how to do that I'd be happy to implement it.

Please also provide any feedback or changes you like to see made to this PR to be merged.

title: Bencode decoding failed
body:
Hi Tatsuhiro.

I'm having problem in adding some torrent file. It seems that Aria2 cannot decode some `base64` strings.

Aria2 can decode almost 99% of torrent files but I've found some torrents that Aria2 can't decode and says:

`{'error': {'code': 1, 'message': 'Bencode decoding failed'}, 'id': 'a', 'jsonrpc': u'2.0'}`

Here is the `base64` encoded torrent file:

``

I'm sure that I've encoded it correctly. Because when I decode and save it to a file, I can add the file to BitTorrent.

Is this a mistake by me or is it a issue related to Aria2?

Thanks.

**Update:**

It's not only RPC. Look:
![aria2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8404511/13845215/b23e90c0-ec53-11e5-9161-e542a9b73b1f.png)

Pretty sure the file is okay as I can add it to BitTorrent.

I hope there isn't something wrong with `BencodeParser.cc`

title: Continue from browser is too complicated or broken
body:
Archlinux, aria2  version 1.20.0

I started to download a file with firefox and tried to continue with aria2 but it always complained about the already existing file. (I removed the .part suffix that firefox adds)

By the manual I thought I just have to give --continue, but it gave:

```
aria2c --continue=true "https://doc-0k-50-docs.googleusercontent.com/docs/securesc/ha0ro937gcuc7l7deffksulhg5h7mbp1/03aro04obf9fo1sloq072hvpiqblr9bh/1457899200000/13695031681336869991/*/0B2xFAgf7BbVHZ1gwWmFhNjFXZ3M?e=download" "http://update.moviebattles.org/files/MBII_1.4_OpenBeta.zip"

03/13 23:27:12 [NOTICE] File already exists. Renamed to /repos/OpenJK/JediAcademy/goo/MBII_1.4_OpenBeta.zip.1.
```

Then I found the --auto-file-renaming option:

```
aria2c --auto-file-renaming=false -c "https://doc-0k-50-docs.googleusercontent.com/docs/securesc/ha0ro937gcuc7l7deffksulhg5h7mbp1/03aro04obf9fo1sloq072hvpiqblr9bh/1457899200000/13695031681336869991/*/0B2xFAgf7BbVHZ1gwWmFhNjFXZ3M?e=download" "http://update.moviebattles.org/files/MBII_1.4_OpenBeta.zip"

03/13 23:27:32 [ERROR] CUID#7 - Download aborted. URI=https://doc-0k-50-docs.googleusercontent.com/docs/securesc/ha0ro937gcuc7l7deffksulhg5h7mbp1/03aro04obf9fo1sloq072hvpiqblr9bh/1457899200000/13695031681336869991/*/0B2xFAgf7BbVHZ1gwWmFhNjFXZ3M?e=download
Exception: [AbstractCommand.cc:394] errorCode=13 URI=https://doc-0k-50-docs.googleusercontent.com/docs/securesc/ha0ro937gcuc7l7deffksulhg5h7mbp1/03aro04obf9fo1sloq072hvpiqblr9bh/1457899200000/13695031681336869991/*/0B2xFAgf7BbVHZ1gwWmFhNjFXZ3M?e=download

I tried a couple more but options (--file-allocation=none, --always-resume=true) but these gave the same error as above. Lastly I tried --allow_overwrite, it just truncated the file. At this point I gave up.

title: Pause problem for torrent added with magnet
body:
I don't know if this is an issue with Aria2, or i'm doing it wrong.
Problem example:
I have a torrent added by "addTorrent" with the corresponding .torrent file and an other one added by "addUri" and the corresponding magnet link.
Aria2 save the session (save-session=file-path) in a file every 20 sec (save-session-interval=20).
If both are active, like seeding, and I pause (with pause('gid')) the one added with the magnet link, the torrent is paused but in the session file the variable "pause=true" is saved under the other torrent. If now I restart the server where aria2 is running, after boot I have now the torrent added with the .torrent file paused, and the one that I previously paused is now active.

Session file after pausing:
`magnet:?....etc...
 gid=b3248894a54a08f3
/mnt/usbhdd/downloads/1e4ce26ee036d7595218f918cc9642db99e59f01.torrent
 gid=6cbca74e04c76674
 pause=true`

The 'gid' that I use to pause the torrent is the one returned by tellActive for the torrent I want to pause, in this case '30a29ef65731b78d', and, for what I understand, I think it is normal that is not present in the session file. I also have the "force-save" option in the config file.

P.S. aria2 version: 1.20.0

EDIT:
The problem seems to occur only when there is "force-save" in the config file, but I need it to keep seeding after reboot.

title: Gaining privilege SeManageVolumePrivilege failed
body:
Since version 1.20.0, aria2 displays an error when I run the binary on Windows 10 (64-bit). The error is the following:

> C:\Users\clamsawd>aria2c
> 
> 02/18 15:19:10 [WARN] Gaining privilege SeManageVolumePrivilege failed.
> 
> 02/18 15:19:10 [WARN] --file-allocation=falloc will not work properly.
> Specify at least one URL.
> Usage: aria2c [OPTIONS] [URI | MAGNET | TORRENT_FILE | METALINK_FILE]...
> See 'aria2c -h'.
> 
> C:\Users\clamsawd>

The error is displayed with my own build ([aria2-1.20.0-win-64bit-build1.7z](https://github.com/clamsawd/aria2-static-builds/releases/download/v1.20.0/aria2-1.20.0-win-64bit-build1.7z)) and with your build ([aria2-1.20.0-win-64bit-build1.zip](https://github.com/tatsuhiro-t/aria2/releases/download/release-1.20.0/aria2-1.20.0-win-64bit-build1.zip)) too. 
If I run the 32-bit binary the error is displayed  too, but If I run the the binary with WINE under Debian 8 is not displayed.

Could be an error of Windows 10 or an error of aria2?

title: Add support for using gnutls system wide crypto policy
body:
Hello,

I'm currently maintaining aria2 package for Fedora and EPEL, I carry a small patch to use gnutls system cipher suite as required by packaging guidelines.

I was wondering if you could merge this patch to make updating package easier since it removes the need to rebase the patch every aria2 release.

title: Impossible to use GID when downloading a torrent
body:
When I set a GID for a torrent download (I'm passing the URL) then aria use my GID for the METADATA and the real download got an automatically generated GID.
This way when the download is completed the hook return a GID different from the one I set.

You can test by yourself `aria2c --gid=0123456789abcdef http://cdimage.debian.org/debian-cd/8.3.0/amd64/bt-cd/debian-8.3.0-amd64-netinst.iso.torrent` 

The result would be something like

```
Download Results:
gid   |stat|avg speed  |path/URI
======+====+===========+=======================================================
012345|OK  |   266KiB/s|/tmp/debian-8.3.0-amd64-netinst.iso.torrent
db980a|OK  |   824KiB/s|/tmp/debian-8.3.0-amd64-netinst.iso
```

So if I try to use the `--on-bt-download-complete` I got the automatically generate GID.

If this is the intended behaviour it pretty frustrating because I cannot know exactly which download is completed while using the JSON-RPC interface.

title: tellStatus provide info on progress of Check Integrity
body:
When aria2 is hashing some larger files it can take a noticeable amount of time to hash. In the aria2c interface you can see the percentage of progress of the hash check. It would be nice to have this information in the tellStatus or some where else accessible via the RPC interface.

I'm not sure if this should be presented as a % or # of pieces checked or something else. What ever you feel is appropriate.

title: DHT seeding
body:
Hi,

I can't find this information anywhere and I've scoured everything I could on this topic - DHT seeding.
1. First, I don't see anything anywhere on creating a trackerless torrent. I think `transmission-cli` is the closest thing I've found. Is that the recommended way? Other **cli** tools fit for this job specifically?
2. I can't figure out how the process actually works. That probably should be described better in the documentation. Say I have 4 machines and all of them are using `DHT`. `aria2c` is running as a daemon on all 4. What would be the approximate sequence of steps for them exchange a brand new file? 

I see `--dht-entry-point` and I think that's in the play somehow, but I"m not sure if I'm missing something fundamental to make it all work.

Thanks much!!

P.S.: Is the github/issues interface a good place to start these questions or there's a forum?

title: tellStatus should return "Seeding"
body: Just like how I can see the status is "SEED" in the aria2c display. It would be helpful for the various ui's built around the RPC interface I would imagine. And for myself in particular.

title: Initializing the seeding
body:
Hi,

I was wondering if there's a way to start seeding through the RPC instead of with the `-V` switch on the command line.

I would ideally like to start `aria2` on all my machines and start seeding on one of them though an RPC call. Is that possible? Otherwise, what's the best practice?

Thanks

title: Rename File
body: Um, could you please add a feature similar to -O function as in wget to specify filename before downloading?

title: Stuck at 99%
body:
I'm giving aria2 a try. I have 4 VMs. I created a torrent for a 1G file. I seeded the torrent with

`aria2c -V path_to_torrent`

I enabled the RPC feature on the other 3VMs. I added the same torrent through an RPC call and they all started downloading. But they consistently stop at 99% and nothing is happening BUT the file on the hard drive is already complete. So somehow `aria2c` doesn't know it has downloaded all of the content?

The `tellActive` RPC call says:

```
  "files"=>
   [{"completedLength"=>"1068302336",
     "index"=>"1",
     "length"=>"1073741824",
     "path"=>"/home/aria2/Downloads/1g_file",
     "selected"=>"true",
     "uris"=>[]}],
```

And `ls -l /home/aria2/Downloads/1g_file` shows `1073741824`.

The status line looks like this:

`[#8b9e1d 0.9GiB/1.0GiB(99%) CN:0 SD:0 DL:0B UL:0B(88MiB)]`

What could be the reason for this?

Thanks.

title: Fixed warning
body: WARNING: unknown option: --save-session-file

title: aria2 1.20.0
body:
We have updated versioning and release schedule plan. https://github.com/tatsuhiro-t/aria2#versioning-and-release-schedule

We follow this plan from the next release, thus next release will be 15th February, and feature and documentation freeze happens 5th February.

title: Could mmap supports max file size?
body: mmap make downloading faster and generating less disk IO which is really important for a low end computer. However, if the file length is bigger than the total number of RAM in machine, aria2 will just crash and slow down the system. Could it be possible to add a setting like mmap-max-file-size and turn off mmap for file bigger than certain size to workaround this problem?

title: Auto reconnect when connection is dropped
body:
I'm using aria2 over a high latency satellite connection. With the max number of parallel connections it's doing a great job so far, however after some time connections are dropped. With a low number of connections, downloads are getting slow. Sometimes even the last connection is dropped and the download gets stuck. Is there a way to force a auto reconnect? Couldn't find anything in the docs. 

Running with those params: 
- continue=true
- always-resume=true
- daemon=false
- file-allocation=falloc
- log-level=warn
- max-connection-per-server=16
- max-concurrent-downloads=3
- max-overall-download-limit=0
- min-split-size=1M
- split=20
- enable-http-pipelining=false
- stream-piece-selector=inorder

title: Change references to sourceforge
body: Considering the mass exodus from sourceforge and the fact that it looks like this project has migrated to https://aria2.github.io/ as its main page, all references to http://aria2.sourceforge.net/ should probably be changed.

title: Updated dependency and source url's
body:
The RaspberryPi Dockerfile had some out-of-date dependency packages and
was downloading an outdated aria2 source from Sourceforge, which
resulted in a build for version 1.19.0.  The new
fetch-latest-release-from-GitHub script I've cooked up should always
work as long as GitHub doesn't change their API and aria2's platform
agnostic releases follow the "{version number}.tar.bz2" naming format.

title: Acquiescently load CA certificate without my command and failed
body:
```
> aria2c --enable-rpc=true --rpc-allow-origin-all=true --rpc-listen-all=true

01/19 13:29:10 [WARN] Neither --rpc-secret nor a combination of --rpc-user and --rpc-passwd is set. This is insecure. It is extremely recommended to specify --rpc-secret with the adequate secrecy or now deprecated --rpc-user and --rpc-passwd.

I must admit that I used `--ca-certificate=` config before. Is it something like having cached the previous option?

title: Client Certificate not working
body:
## scene 1

I wrote **aria2.conf** with `certificate=/path/to/client.p12`, which have a blank passphrase, and got this error.

```
01/17 11:01:54 [ERROR] Failed to import PKCS12 file. If you meant to use PEM, you'll also have to specify --rpc-private-key. See the manual.
```
## scene 2

I wrote **aria2.conf** with `certificate=/path/to/client.pem` and `private-key=/path/to/client.key` and got another error.

```
01/17 11:05:35 [ERROR] Failed to load certificate from /path/to/client.pem and private key from /path/to/client.key. Cause: ASN1 parser: Error in DER parsing.
```
## my query

Does the manual of aria2 mean to use client's certificate files in the settings above?
Or, is it not my misuse but something else?

PS: I've dug the whole internet with my ability and found nothing except dozens of duplicated manuals.

Please help, thanks! :)

title: Check Content-MD5 HTTP header
body:
I couldn't find any info on it, so I assume that the feature doesn't exist.
It would be nice if one could supply a flag to aria2 to check the [Content-MD5 HTTP header](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.15) if a server gives it.
It would be similar to if the user supplied an MD5 checksum directly to aria2.  Slight difference is that Content-MD5 is affected by Content-Encoding.

The value should be 'saved' (similar to Content-Length) in case ranged requests don't return a Content-MD5.
The header could also appear in a HTTP trailer, so that should be checked too.

Thanks for the excellent download utility! :)

title: Using multiple interfaces breaks Local Peer Discovery
body:
@sarim, @tatsuhiro-t, thank you for adding multiple interfaces support in #364. The feature mostly works and finally allows to utilize whole bandwidth. ;)

Unfortunately it has also introduced a bug.

title: Log to stderr instead of stdout.
body:
Hello, 

This is a response to https://github.com/tatsuhiro-t/aria2/issues/510. I think logging to stderr is better in general because users can choose what to see from different streams. (Specifically they can use `2>/dev/null` to hide console logs.) I compiled the updated program and it runs correctly, but you may want to double check nothing is left out by this change. Thank you.

title: Support --continue in bt downloads
body:
I found this in `man aria2c`:

> -c, --continue[=true|false]
> Continue downloading a partially downloaded file.  Use this option to resume a download started by a
> web browser or another  program  which downloads  files sequentially  from the beginning.  Currently
> this option is only applicable to HTTP(S)/FTP downloads.

Does this mean `-c` doesn't work in bt downloads? Or is this man page outdated on this? Domo arigado.

it requests "URL=http://some.xxx.com/1.iso?src=111%20http://some.yyy.com/1.iso?src=kkk"

```

title: Correct dockerfile instruction
body:
In Dockerfile.mingw you've little instruction

```
# $ sudo docker build -t aria2-mingw - < Dockerfile.mingw
#
# After successful build, windows binary is located at
# /aria2/src/aria2c.exe.  You can copy the binary using
#
# $ sudo docker cp <containerId>:/aria2/src/aria2c.exe <dest>
```

but after `docker build` command you don't have container, only image. So, to copy compiled file you must first create container from image.
i suggest to add this code

```
# $ sudo docker build -t aria2-mingw - < Dockerfile.mingw
#
# After successful build, windows binary is located at
# /aria2/src/aria2c.exe.  You can copy the binary using
#
# sudo id=$(docker create aria2-mingw)
# sudo docker cp $id:/aria2/src/aria2c.exe <dest>
# sudo docker rm -v $id
```

it is for those who are not familiar with the docker

title: Send the last error message as part of tellStatus RPC response
body: I added a new field "errorMessage" to the aria2.tellStatus JSON-RPC response. It provides more information than just the numeric error code. For example, it contains the HTTP error status code returned from the remote server.

title: Hanging CLOSE_WAIT connection when in daemon mode
body:
I am using aria2 as a daemon listening on its RPC interface and being controlled by a web UI (https://github.com/ziahamza/webui-aria2). When all downloads are finished and stopped using that UI, aria2 closes almost all connections, (possibly) always leaving one connection hanging in the CLOSE_WAIT state. This seems to be an error on aria2's part.

This causes trouble for me because I am listing all open connections and using the result as one of the conditions for putting my server to sleep. Currently every time I download something, aria will keep one connection open, resulting in the server being running until I restart aria.

title: on-bt-download-complete does not work
body:
In relation to issue #382 https://github.com/tatsuhiro-t/aria2/issues/382, I wrote a short script which kills aria2c daemon, then restarts it. I would like to run this script every time a bittorrent download is completed. The script is in /usr/local/bin/aria2c_restart

However, if I put 

on-bt-download-complete=/usr/local/bin/aria2c_restart

into my config file, then aria2c daemon quits almost immediately after started. Further, if I use aria2rpc to add this option, for a particular torrent, then I get an error message about --on-bt-download-complete, and the download does not start. I am using self-compiled 1.19.2 version on raspbian jessie.

title: aria2c never retries 404 or other http errors
body:
Using `aria2 version 1.19.2` on windows 64
I have a local server with which I test download behavior under errors:

I have a simple php script that simulates 4xx, 5xx and so on:

```
<?php
http_response_code(404);
exit;
?>
```

I call aria2c like bellow:

```
aria2c --async-dns=false \
  --auto-file-renaming=false \
  --check-certificate=false \
  --conditional-get=true \
  --allow-overwrite=true \
  --always-resume=true \
  --http-no-cache=true \
  --max-file-not-found=0 \
  --max-tries=20 \
  --retry-wait=5 \
  http://localhost/script.php -o stat.dwn
```

I expect aria2c to sleep 5 seconds and retry 20 times before quiting.
The behavior that I get is that aria2c _never retries downloading_, 404 or any other different error code.
Am I doing something wrong, is this the expected behavior ?
